alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 10:31PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Cherokee and Clay. Portions of east Tennessee, including the following county, Monroe. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas and fast rises on creeks and streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1129 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding as well as flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Murphy, Unaka, Citico and Brasstown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
